body_html:
Thank you. @soumith
when i change the input to 4d tensor : X = inputX.resize_(1, 3, 64, 64), and use encZ.evaluate(),
the error 'assert input.dim() == 2' still occures, it must be something wrong in
'(13): nn.Linear(4096 -> 512)'
we could not change the input size of '(13): nn.Linear(4096 -> 512)',aren't we?
Should I change the encZ model ?that means i should redesign the model and train it again?

body:
Thank you. @soumith 
when i change the input to 4d tensor : X = inputX.resize_(1, 3, 64, 64), and use encZ.evaluate(), 
 the error 'assert input.dim() == 2' still  occures, it must be something wrong in
 '(13): nn.Linear(4096 -> 512)'
we could not change the input size of  '(13): nn.Linear(4096 -> 512)',aren't we?
Should I change the  encZ model ?that means i should redesign the model and train it again?
